segments.text: Bill O'Reilly here, Thursday, October 28th, 2021.
You are listening to the O'Reilly update.
Here's what's happening across our nation.
Immigrant arrests plummet under President Biden.
The government issues the first gender-neutral passport.
Polls show more Americans worried about inflation than COVID.
Cigarette sales rise for the first time in 20 years.
Also ahead, canceling Halloween.
Why are they doing that?
But first, arrests of illegal immigrants already living
in the USA dropping sharply under Joe Biden.
Just 70,000 people were detained by ICE
during the fiscal year 2021, which ended September 30th.
That figure was 145,000 for Donald Trump's
last year in office, a 50% decline under Biden.
At least 1.7 million people have illegally entered the USA
in the previous 12 months.
And there are even more than that,
because those are just the ones encountered
by federal authorities.
Now, the problem is so bad that Joe Biden doesn't want
to visit the border.
He says he doesn't have time.
So the American people are left with a situation
where this problem will continue.
The State Department offering Americans a third gender
option on the passport.
Starting early next year, people can choose male, female,
or the letter X. The US Special Envoy for LGBTQ rights.
They're praising the decision saying, quote,
when a person obtains identity documents
that reflect their true identity,
they live with greater dignity.
Well, I wouldn't want to be going to Pakistan
with a passport that says X.
A survey from Fox News says more Americans are concerned
about inflation than the pandemic.
82% believe high prices pose a grave threat
to the nation compared to 74% worried about the virus.
Finally, more Americans are lighting up this year,
the sale of tobacco products rising for the first time
in two decades.
Marber all executives say more Americans turn to tobacco
during the COVID shutdown out of boredom and depression.
That makes sense with this caveat.
If COVID doesn't kill you, cigarettes will.
In a moment, canceling Halloween,
it's an outrage right back.
Wall Street tells us to put our money in an IRA or 401K,
telling you that risking your life savings
in the Wall Street Casino is a secure investment
in your future.
But did you know the average American who follows that advice
might outlive their savings by 10 years?
With bank on yourself, grow and protect your hard earned
money.
This retirement plan alternative has never had a loss
in more than 160 years.
Your tax rate will be zero in retirement.
It's guaranteed predictable growth and retirement income.
Your plan doesn't go backward when the markets stumble.
Both your principal and growth are locked in.
So get a free report with details on how to bank on yourself
and the strategy that entails.
Ads guarantees predictability and control
to your financial plan.
Go to bankonyourself.com slash no spin.
That's bankonyourself.com slash no spin.
Time now for the O'Reilly update message of the day.
The woke cancel culture is a bad thing.
My opinion, but I believe many Americans agree with me.
Here's an example.
Halloween, most kids love that.
But the cancel fascists despise Halloween.
Schools in Washington state, Massachusetts, Michigan
and other places, canceling Halloween parties
to promote equity.
The decision to drop the pumpkin parade
at Seattle's Benjamin Franklin Day School
came from the administration's racial equity team.
We need that in grammar schools, don't we?
According to the team, Hollywood costumes and loud noises
make some students feel uncomfortable and afraid.
Well, boom.
Some administrators claim the costumes
pose a financial hardship for lower income and minority
families.
That's bull.
When I was a kid, money was tight.
So we made our own costumes and had fun doing it.
However, woke monsters want to ban the following costumes.
Ready?
Pocahontas entanto, the Lone Rangers associate, out.
Aladdin, Mulan, Tiger Lily, God, Sombrero's, Panchos,
fake mustaches.
Sorry, Groucho Marx.
Pregnant women, police officers, hobos, soldiers, prisoners,
religious figures like priests or rabbis.
Don't you dare go in costume for any of the above.
Isn't this ridiculous?
I mean, come on.
This is so bad because it reflects a serious side
to American society, the march toward a totalitarian society,
where the culture police, the far left zealots dictate
what is acceptable and public.
Halloween is just another step in that direction.
So don't come to my house for trick or treat if you are woke.
And all costumes will be welcomed by me unless they are cruel
and meant to diminish people.
Wearing a Sombrero does not reflect poorly on Mexicans.
It's a compliment.
It looks good.
Clint Eastwood had one.
What's going on here?
I will tell you once again that the far left wants to wipe out
all American tradition.
This is what Mao Zedong did in China with the Great Revolution,
the cultural revolution there beginning in 1949.
Look it up.
Mao wiped out all Chinese cultural expressions
and replaced them with communist propaganda blather.
If you go to China today, you won't see anything but totalitarianism.
That's what the far left wants here.
And they use race and gender to promote it.
I'm Bill O'Reilly.
I approve the message by writing it.
For more honest news analysis, please go to BillOReilly.com.
You can reach me, by the way, Bill at BillOReilly.com,
name in town if you wish to opine.
In a moment, something you might not know.
Everything is expensive these days.
You know that.
The government is printing trillions of dollars in consumer prices higher than ever.
If the government continues its printing and spending,
the dollar could continue its free fall and lose its coveted role as the world reserve
currency.
Let's hope that doesn't happen.
But there are a few things you can do right now.
American hard-for-go can show you how to protect your money,
your retirement, your hard-earned savings, against inflation by helping you diversify
a portion of your portfolio into physical gold and silver.
Start with a short phone call and they can have physical gold and silver delivered right
to your door or put inside your 401K or IRA.
So please call or text them right now.
Tell them Bill O'Reilly sent you.
Call 877-444-GOLD 877-444-GOLD or text GOLD to 65532.
Again, that's 877-444-GOLD or text GOLD to 65532.
Now the O'Reilly update brings you something you might not know.
135 years ago today, leaders from Washington and Paris, France gathered in New York Harbor.
In Grover, Cleveland officially dedicated a 151-foot monument to the cause of freedom.
The Statue of Liberty had arrived.
Here is the story.
Originally known as Liberty and Lightning the World, the work was proposed by France to
commemorate the Franco-American Alliance during the Revolutionary War.
In February 1877, Congress approved the use of a site on a tiny island off Manhattan.
Seven years later, the statue was completed in France then disassembled and brought to
America where a cornerstone had been laid.
In June 1885, the statue arrived in 200 shipping containers, each weighing more than a ton.
That's a big haul, and it was put together here on Liberty Island.
Hundreds of workers reassembled the monument.
The final plaque was fitted October 28, 1886.
More than a million people attended the opening ceremony.
Six years after the dedication and immigration processing facility was opened on nearby Ellis
Island.
From that point on, the Statue of Liberty would be known all over the world as a beacon
of freedom for those fleeing oppression.
From 1892 to 1954, 15 million immigrants entered the USA at Ellis Island, and this country
was glad to have them.
And here's something else you might not know.
Haiti Liberty's famous motto was added 17 years after President Cleveland dedicated
the statue.
In 1903, a poem called The New Colossus by Emma Lazarus was added to the lower pedestal
of the statue that welcomed migrants.
It reads, quote, give me your tired, your poor, your huddled masses yearning to breathe
free.
The Statue of Liberty remains one of the most popular tourist attractions in the world.
Each year, at least five million people visit the island in New York Harbor.
As one who goes there often, the statue is magnificent.
Back after this.
There's a big difference between talking and reporting, especially right now with a
fire hose worth of news coming your way.
You know what helps?
Having reporters in the field.
I'm Brad Milke from ABC News, and that's what we've got on ABC's Daily Podcast Start
Here.
Every morning, Start Here takes you across the country and around the world for a quick,
smart look at the stories that matter.
It's fast, it's straightforward, and sometimes gasp.
News can even be fun.
So let's meet up tomorrow morning.
Listen to Start Here, wherever you get your podcasts.
Thank you for listening to the O'Reilly update.
I am Bill O'Reilly.
No spin, just facts, and always looking out for you.
